content.question: The data in the first table most directly indicate which of the following about the professions of soldiers in the Civil War?

choices.label: The Confederacy enlisted more factory workers to fill its armies than did the Union.
The Confederacy relied more heavily on agricultural workers to fill its armies than did the Union.
The majority of soldiers in both Confederate and Union forces were sharecroppers.
The Confederacy enlisted more skilled workers than did the Union.

content.answer: The Confederacy relied more heavily on agricultural workers to fill its armies than did the Union.
